manpage.name: tcpping
manpage.desc: ping(8) written using TCP SYN probes

synopsis.cmd: tcpping [-v] [-c count] [-p port] [-i interval] [-I interface] [-t ttl] [-S srcaddress] remote_host

description.p: is a utility designed to emulate standard in nearly every meaningful way and only diverge when necessary. It sends out forged TCP SYN packets and listens for a SYN/ACK, RST, or ICMP Time Exceeded message. It counts and reports on these results using an interface that is nearly identical to standard UNIX ping.

option.optdesc: Send packets to PORT instead of TCP port 80
Wait INTERVAL seconds between packets (can be a decimal). Defaults to 1s
Send packets from, and probe for responses on, the given INTERFACE. Defaults to the first external UP interface though it is not very robust.
Set TTL as the IP TTL for the probes. Defaults to "sufficiently high"
Set SRCADDRESS as the source address instead of the default IP of INTERFACE

section.name: Security
section.p: requires the CAP_NET_RAW capability and is therefore installed as set-uid root. Though numerous steps are taken to ensure safety here (clearing the environment, safe input checks) there is always some inherent risk.

section.name: Author
section.p: tcpping was originally written by Steven Kehlet <steven@kehlet.cx>. It is now maintained by Jim Wyllie <jwyllie83@gmail.com> and has received contributions from numerous individuals.
